headline.main: Delegates Meet in First Step Toward Post-Taliban Rule

lead_paragraph: With the fighting in Afghanistan outpacing the effort to shape a post-Taliban order there, representatives of most of the key factions gathered here today for informal consultations before a conference to try to organize a broadly based and representative government. Organized by the United Nations but dominated by Western allies and their Afghan proxies, the conference, scheduled to begin on Tuesday in a secluded and well-guarded former government guesthouse, is intended to produce a transitional executive administration for Kabul and those parts of Afghanistan not held by the Taliban.
abstract: Representatives from rival political and ethnic factions in Afghanistan meet in Bonn, Germany, for informal consultations prior to conference aimed at organizing broadly based and representative post-Taliban government; organized by UN but dominated by Western allies and Afghan proxies, conference is intended to produce transitional executive administration for Kabul and parts of country not held by Taliban; photos (M)
